One Journey. One Planet. Thousands of Voices.

A curated collection of articles, social media posts, interviews, and news coverage documenting an extraordinary 1,200+ km journey on foot — undertaken to raise awareness about climate change. This page brings together verified sources, visual moments, and firsthand stories that capture the purpose, challenges, and global conversations sparked along the way.
This Man Plans to Walk 12,000 km from Malta to India

Times of Malta covers Jaydip Lakhankiya’s bold plan to walk over 12,000 km from Malta to India over approximately 18 months to raise awareness about climate change. The article highlights his purpose, route across 20+ countries, and the environmental message behind choosing to travel entirely on foot.
Malta Daily Facebook Post: Climate Walk Announcement

A Facebook post by Malta Daily sharing Jaydip’s latest update on his planned 12,000 km climate walk from Malta to India, urging readers to follow along and read the full article linked in the post. The social mention helps amplify the walk’s climate awareness message.
Malta Daily Covers Jaydip’s Climate Walk Plans

MaltaDaily highlights Jaydip Lakhankiya’s ambitious plan to walk approximately 12,000 km from Malta toz India beginning January 2026, crossing over 20 countries in about 1.5 years to raise awareness about climate change and inspire sustainable action. The article reinforces the mission’s global outlook and community engagement.
What It Takes to Walk Across 20 Countries for Climate Awareness

Who’s Who Malta explores the realities behind planning a 12,000 km walk from Malta to India, from navigating visas and desert heat to preparing dozens of pairs of shoes. The article offers a personal look at the physical, logistical, and mental preparation required for a 1.5-year journey aimed at raising awareness about climate change.
Lovin Malta Shares the Story Behind the Climate Walk

Lovin Malta highlights Jaydip Lakhankiya’s upcoming 12,000 km walk from Malta to India to raise awareness about climate change and inspire sustainable action. The post reflects on his background as a long-distance backpacker, his commitment to carbon-neutral travel, and his plan to document the journey daily through social media.
897 Bay Official Shares the Climate Walk Mission

897 Bay Official shared an Instagram post announcing Jaydip Lakhankiya’s upcoming 12,000 km walk from Malta to India, scheduled to begin in January 2026. The post highlights the 1.5-year journey across 20 countries, the use of minimal ferry crossings, and the broader goal of promoting climate awareness and sustainable living through global engagement.
FreeHour Malta Highlights the Climate Walk to India

FreeHour Malta shared an Instagram reel featuring Jaydip Lakhankiya, a 25-year-old climate activist planning a 12,000 km walk from Malta to India to raise awareness about climate change. The post outlines the 1.5-year journey across 20 countries, emphasising carbon-free travel, community conversations, and the belief that one individual can create global impact.
